data.title: Anu Initiative (ReFi)
data.description:
**üå± Anu Initiative (ReFi) - Trust in Service of Mother Nature**

**Objective:** Open-Source Web2+Web3 Platform for Charities

**Website:** https://anuinitiative.org

**GitHub:** https://github.com/Anu-Initiative

**üå± Who Are We?**

Anu Initiative is a Company Limited by Guarantee (not-for-profit), incorporated in Dublin, Ireland. Founded by nature lovers, we are dedicated to creating a positive impact on the planet.

We are **NOT** just another carbon credits organisation! Our mission is to deliver real, tangible on-the-ground ecological impact through innovative approaches.

**üå± **Roadmap****

**Development:**

‚úÖ Complete Smart Contract professional review (In progress)
GitHub: Smart Contracts

üé® Complete front-end design and development for the App (In progress)
GitHub: Front-End

üîó Develop Chainlink Oracle (Not yet started)

**Administrative:**

üìù Complete Charity Registration with the Charities Regulator in Ireland (In progress)

We currently have 4 Charity Trustees:

Jimi Cohen / John Ruth / Saray Levi / Drew Simon

‚û°Ô∏è We need at least 2 more Trustees to complete the board.

üè¶ Register as a Virtual Asset Service Provider with the Central Bank of Ireland (Pending charity registration)

Partnership with KYC Bot to be formalized.

üåê Formalize a partnership with a major blockchain provider (e.g., Celo, Optimism, Arbitrum, etc.).

Go-Live Target Date: Q1 of 2025 üöÄ

**Supporting Study**

üìö Summary: [Philanthropy‚Äôs Blockchain Uptake is Slow, but Future is Bright](https://www.coindesk.com/opinion/2024/07/17/philanthropys-blockchain-uptake-is-slow-but-future-is-bright/)

üìë Full Research Report: [An Inquiry into Transparent and Accountable Giving](https://forum.anuinitiative.org/t/an-inquiry-into-transparent-and-accountable-giving/90)

**üå± Let's Take the Initiative! ‚ú®**
data.problem:
üî¥**Problems Addressed**

The global environmental crisis, characterized by unprecedented levels of biodiversity loss, deforestation, climate change, soil degradation, and other challenges, poses a pressing issue for humanity.

Traditional fundraising methods often suffer from issues such as lack of transparency, high operating costs, and a lack of trust, which can limit the effectiveness of efforts to address these challenges.

‚ùóLack of transparency and trust - It can be difficult for donors to know how their donations are being used, how much was used for Impact vs. Operations, etc.

‚ùóMiddlemen and overhead cost - A portion of donations may be used to cover operational and administrative expenses.

‚ùóPotential for fraud - There have been many cases of charity organizations misusing funds or being outright scams.

‚ùóLimited control - Once a donation is made, the donor typically has no further say in how the funds are used or distributed.

‚ùóLimited or no connection with impact generated - Once a donation is made, the donor typically isn‚Äôt made aware of the actual impact generated by their generosity.
data.solution:
üí° **Our Solution**

‚úÖ We designed a platform that connects the donor with the impact generated by their generosity that provides full transparency and accessibility to track all donations and contributions to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs Treasury all the way to Actual Impact generated by our trusty Impact Partners.

‚úÖ By integrating these solutions, Anu Initiative can help overcome the traditional challenges of environmental fundraising and create a robust, transparent, and effective mechanism for environmental impact.

‚úÖ Blockchain Technology for Transparency - Utilize blockchain tech to track donations from the moment they are made until they are spent, and moreover, all the way down to the impact generated. This ensures that donors can see exactly where their money is going and how it is being used, addressing the transparency and trust issues.

‚úÖ Direct Impact Tracking - Develop a system that connects donations to specific projects and outcomes in a live manner. For each project funded, there should be a clear set of expected results, and donors and the public should receive reports on the project's progress and impact. Funded projects should be displayed on a public dashboard.

‚úÖ Reduce Overhead with Technology - Automate various administrative and operational tasks using software to reduce the need for middlemen and cut down on overhead costs. This allows a larger portion of donations to go directly to ecological projects.

‚úÖ Engagement and Feedback Loop - Create a platform where donors can vote on projects they want to support, providing them with control over how their donations are used and fostering a deeper connection with the impact generated.

‚úÖ Impact Investment Fund - Establish a fund to invest in startups and technologies that provide ecological benefits, with profits being reinvested into the Anu Initiative‚Äôs projects.

‚úÖ Feedback and Adaptation - Implement a feedback mechanism where donors, partners, and beneficiaries can suggest improvements to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs processes, ensuring that the organization remains responsive and adaptable to the needs of the environment and its stakeholders.
data.missionSummary:
**Our Mission**
To provide for those that provide for Mother Earth.

**Our Vision**
Sustain an ecosystem in which the kindness of our community creates lasting, positive impacts for our planet through the ecologically-conscious charities of the world.

**Our Values**
Transparency, Passion, Integrity, Commitment, and Community.

These are‚ÄØour fundamental beliefs, and they define who we are. They guide our thoughts, actions, and behaviour; they influence the way we work with each other and the way we serve Mother Nature and the Anu Initiative community.
data.businessModel: Fundraising for those who transparently provide for Mother Earth!
data.pathToTake: Want to grow through just grant funding

data.description:
**Anu Initiative - Trusty Tech in service of Mother Nature**

**Website:** https://anuinitiative.org

**Github:** https://github.com/Anu-Initiative

**KarmaHQ:** https://gap.karmahq.xyz/project/anu-initiative-refi-1

**üå±Who are we?**

Anu Initiative is a Company Limited by Guarantee (not-for-profit) incorporated in Dublin, Ireland. It was founded by nature lovers to create a positive impact on the planet.

We are NOT another carbon credits based organization! We aim on delivering real, tangible ecological impact.

**üî¥Problems Addressed**

1. The global environmental crisis, characterized by unprecedented levels of biodiversity loss, deforestation, climate change, soil degradation, and other challenges, poses a pressing issue for humanity.

2. Traditional fundraising methods often suffer from issues such as lack of transparency, high operating costs, and a lack of trust, which can limit the effectiveness of efforts to address these challenges.

‚ùóLack of transparency and trust - It can be difficult for donors to know how their donations are being used, how much was used for Impact vs. Operations, etc.

‚ùóMiddlemen and overhead cost - A portion of donations may be used to cover operational and administrative expenses.

‚ùóPotential for fraud - There have been many cases of charity organizations misusing funds or being outright scams.

‚ùóLimited control - Once a donation is made, the donor typically has no further say in how the funds are used or distributed.

‚ùóLimited or no connection with impact generated - Once a donation is made, the donor typically isn‚Äôt made aware of the actual impact generated by their generosity.

**üí° Our Solution**

‚úÖWe designed a platform that connects the donor with the impact generated by their generosity that provides full transparency and accessibility to track all donations and contributions to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs Treasury all the way to Actual Impact generated by our trusty Impact Partners.

‚úÖBy integrating these solutions, Anu Initiative can help overcome the traditional challenges of environmental fundraising and create a robust, transparent, and effective mechanism for environmental impact.

‚úÖBlockchain Technology for Transparency - Utilize blockchain tech to track donations from the moment they are made until they are spent, and moreover, all the way down to the impact generated. This ensures that donors can see exactly where their money is going and how it is being used, addressing the transparency and trust issues.

‚úÖDirect Impact Tracking - Develop a system that connects donations to specific projects and outcomes in a live manner. For each project funded, there should be a clear set of expected results, and donors and the public should receive reports on the project's progress and impact. Funded projects should be displayed on a public dashboard.

‚úÖReduce Overhead with Technology - Automate various administrative and operational tasks using software to reduce the need for middlemen and cut down on overhead costs. This allows a larger portion of donations to go directly to environmental projects.

‚úÖEngagement and Feedback Loop - Create a platform where donors can vote on projects they want to support, providing them with control over how their donations are used and fostering a deeper connection with the impact generated.

‚úÖImpact Investment Fund - Establish a fund to invest in startups and technologies that provide ecological benefits, with profits being reinvested into the Anu Initiative‚Äôs projects.

‚úÖFeedback and Adaptation - Implement a feedback mechanism where donors, partners, and beneficiaries can suggest improvements to the Anu Initiative‚Äôs processes, ensuring that the organization remains responsive and adaptable to the needs of the environment and its stakeholders.

**üå±Roadmap:**

**Administrative:**
1. Complete Charity Registration with the Charities Regulator (Ireland) - (in progress)

Currently we have 4x Charity Trustees and 1x Charity 
Current Charity Trustees:
- Jimi Cohen
- John Ruth
- Saray Levi
- Drew Simon

We need at least 2x more Trustees

2.  Register as a Virtual Asset Service Provider with the Central Bank of Ireland (not yet started - pending Charity registration)

Partnership to be formalised with KYC Bot.

3. Formal partnership a main Blockchain provider like Celo / Optimism / Arbitrum, etc.

**Development:**
1. Finish the Smart Contract professional review (in progress)

https://github.com/Anu-Initiative/smart-contracts 

2. Finish front-end design and development for the App (in progress)

https://github.com/Anu-Initiative/front-end

3. Finish developing the Chainlink Oracle (not yet started).

Go-live target date: Q1 of 2025.

**Supporting Study:**
- Summary: https://www.coindesk.com/opinion/2024/07/17/philanthropys-blockchain-uptake-is-slow-but-future-is-bright/

- Full Research Report: https://forum.anuinitiative.org/t/an-inquiry-into-transparent-and-accountable-giving/90

**Open-Source Commitment**
- Anu Initiative is committed to **open-source principles**, ensuring transparency and innovation within the Web3 ecosystem. Our platform operates under the **GNU General Public License (GPL) Version 2, June 1991**, which allows any charity or community to adopt, modify, and extend our codebase. This encourages collaboration and participation from developers, environmental activists, and blockchain enthusiasts.

**License Information:**
- All core components, including our smart contracts and platform, are licensed under the GNU General Public License Version 2
- This ensures that any modifications or distributions of our code remain open-source and benefit the broader community.

üå±Let's take the initiative!

data.title: Front-End Design for Anu Initiative App
data.description:
**Objective:**
To complete the front-end design of the Anu Initiative app, ensuring an intuitive, user-friendly interface that reflects our mission of environmental impact and transparency.

**Key Deliverables:**
- A seamless donation interface allowing users to contribute to ecological projects.
- Real-time impact visualization, enabling users to track their contributions' environmental changes.
- A rewards and leaderboard system that engages users and fosters community interaction.
- A detailed Impact Map showcasing supported projects, highlighting key benefits such as CO2 reduction, water conservation, and reforestation.

**Timeline:**
Complete by November 2024.

**Success Criteria:**
- Completion of design reviews and feedback rounds.
- Approval from key stakeholders on final front-end design.
- Handover to the development team for integration with back-end systems.

questions.query: Project GitHub Repo
questions.explanation: https://github.com/Anu-Initiative

questions.query: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile associated with previous rounds.
questions.explanation: Yes - community round Real World Builders

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: The Anu Initiative accelerates the growth of the Open Source Software (OSS) ecosystem by providing a platform that any charity can easily adopt ("lift and shift") to reduce operational overhead, introduce new fundraising mechanisms, and unify Web2 and Web3 technologies. This open-source tool simplifies administration, reduces costs, and maximizes impact by enabling transparent project tracking and reporting. The integration of blockchain ensures transparency, which empowers more frequent donations by enhancing donor trust. By offering innovative solutions that merge traditional and decentralized technologies, Anu makes it easier for organizations to engage with the Web3 ecosystem, streamlining operations while fostering increased financial inclusion and social impact.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: The Anu Initiative dApp is designed with a user-friendly interface, ensuring ease of use for both donors and charities. The platform seamlessly integrates Web2 and Web3 functionalities, yet users don‚Äôt need to be aware of the underlying blockchain technology that powers the system. Donors can contribute with minimal friction, and charities can manage their projects without requiring specialized technical knowledge. This simplicity allows the focus to remain on the positive social and environmental impact being generated, rather than the complexities of the technology behind it. By prioritizing usability and removing technological barriers, Anu maximizes accessibility while maintaining the transparency and trust that blockchain provides.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Our further development plans also include wallet abstraction and the creation of noncustodial wallets to enhance user experience. This will allow donors to interact with the platform without the need for deep technical knowledge or direct handling of private keys. By integrating noncustodial wallets, we ensure that users maintain full control of their assets while interacting with the platform securely and easily.

The grant funds will support this initiative by facilitating the development and testing of these wallet features, ensuring that users can seamlessly participate in on-chain donations and impact tracking without being burdened by the complexities of Web3 wallet management. This will further improve accessibility and security, aligning with our goal of making the platform user-friendly and efficient.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
Our project strengthens the open-source ecosystem by providing a transparent, Web2-Web3 hybrid Charity Management System that enables seamless donations, real-time impact tracking, and a gamified referral system, all while remaining fully auditable on-chain. By open-sourcing key components such as smart contracts for donations and treasury management, modular Web3 payment infrastructure, and a decentralized impact verification framework, we empower developers and mission-driven organizations to integrate zero-fee, verifiable giving mechanisms into their own platforms. This lowers technical barriers for nonprofits and regenerative projects, allowing them to leverage blockchain‚Äôs trustless nature without needing deep expertise in smart contract development.

Beyond direct integrations, our system introduces soul-bound dNFTs as reusable, non-transferable proof-of-donation models, creating a foundation for decentralized identity in philanthropy. These dNFTs, along with our open-source referral and rewards framework, can be adapted for incentive-driven ecosystems beyond charity, extending into carbon credit markets, regenerative finance, and community-based impact initiatives. By contributing these innovations back to the OSS community, we not only enhance transparency and trust in digital philanthropy but also drive the adoption of decentralized tools for broader social and environmental impact.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Our app offers a seamless, user-friendly donation experience that bridges Web2 and Web3, allowing anyone, individuals or businesses, to donate via Stripe or crypto with zero fees while automatically receiving a soul-bound dNFT as proof of donation and impact. Unlike rigid donation platforms, it is fully customizable, enabling charities to tailor impact tracking for any cause, environmental, social, or humanitarian, with real-time transparency on how funds are used. The system includes a gamified referral model, rewarding donors with Anu Initiative Tokens (AIT) and progressive status levels, making giving both engaging and verifiable. 

By combining ease of use, full auditability, and modular impact tracking, we create an accessible, trust-driven ecosystem that any charity can adopt without technical complexity.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation:
Our focus is on completing the design, development, and full launch of Anu Initiative, ensuring a seamless Charity Management System that any nonprofit can adopt with zero technical friction. 

Grant funds will be used to finalize the front-end and back-end development, complete smart contract audits for security, and integrate impact tracking and referral reward mechanisms. This will enable customizable, transparent donations for any cause while making the platform fully scalable for global adoption.

data.title: GoodDollar Builders Program: Kickoff QF Round

questions.query: Project Description: Briefly describe your project and how it enhances G$ utility or adoption
questions.explanation: Anu Initiative is a Charity Management System that enables seamless G$ token donations, allowing users to support verified charitable causes with zero fees and full transparency. By integrating G$ as a donation currency, we expand its real-world utility, linking contributions directly to ecological and social impact. Donors receive soul-bound dNFTs as proof of impact, and all transactions are tracked on-chain, ensuring full auditability. This integration enhances G$ adoption, incentivizes engagement through referral-based rewards, and creates a scalable model for transparent, impact-driven giving within the GoodDollar ecosystem.

questions.query: Technical Implementation: Describe your approach and how it integrates with GoodDollar. For new builders, outline your implementation plan.
questions.explanation: We will integrate G$ donations by enabling seamless wallet connections through the G$ Identity SDK, allowing users to authenticate and donate in GoodDollar tokens with zero fees. Our smart contracts on Celo will be enhanced to support G$ transactions, ensuring full on-chain transparency and verifiable impact. Donors will receive soul-bound dNFTs as proof of donation and impact, and all contributions will be tracked within the Anu Initiative system, strengthening G$ adoption and real-world utility in philanthropy.

questions.query: Team Capability: Highlight your team's relevant experience and past delivery of similar projects, particularly in the Web3 space or with GoodDollar. Please add relevant links to members GitHub, Twitter, LinkedIn, etc as needed.
questions.explanation:
https://www.coindesk.com/opinion/2024/07/17/philanthropys-blockchain-uptake-is-slow-but-future-is-bright

https://www.linkedin.com/in/mihai-daniel/

https://github.com/anu-initiative

questions.query: Roadmap & Milestones: Outline 3-5 key milestones with timeframes demonstrating how you'll deliver value to the GoodDollar ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
We will first launch Anu Initiative (Q3 2025), integrating G$ donations, impact tracking, and soul-bound dNFTs for full transparency. 

Next, we will finalize the Charity Management System, making it easily customizable for any cause, allowing nonprofits to seamlessly accept G$ donations. 

Finally, we will offer the platform for free to the charity sector, leveraging a database of 140,000 active charities, driving mass adoption of GoodDollar in philanthropy.

questions.query: User Adoption Strategy: How will you attract users to your project and drive G$ adoption? Include specific strategies or metrics. You can find more details on the engagement rewards to support this at: https://engagement-rewards.vercel.app/
questions.explanation:
We will drive G$ adoption by integrating Engagement Rewards, leveraging a built-in referral system to expand user participation organically. Users will be able to donate in G$ seamlessly, with all contributions tracked on-chain for full transparency. 

By onboarding charities from our 140,000+ active charity database, we ensure widespread adoption, making G$ a recognized donation currency in the nonprofit sector. 

Additionally, we will collaborate with GoodDollar-aligned Web3 projects and promote the system through targeted outreach to impact-driven communities, positioning G$ as the default token for transparent philanthropy.

questions.query: Funding Allocation: How will you allocate the funding to maximize impact? Provide a simple breakdown of resource allocation.
questions.explanation: We will allocate the funding primarily to completing the design and development of the Charity Management System, ensuring seamless G$ donation integration, impact tracking, and referral functionality. Resources will be used for smart contract audits, front-end and back-end development, and optimizing the user experience to maximize adoption. This ensures a fully functional, scalable platform that enables charities worldwide to accept G$ donations with zero friction, driving real-world impact and long-term ecosystem growth.

questions.query: Ecosystem Contribution: How does your project complement existing initiatives in the GoodDollar ecosystem rather than competing with them?
questions.explanation: Our project complements the GoodDollar ecosystem by expanding G$ utility into the philanthropy sector, enabling seamless, transparent donations to verified charities without competing with existing DeFi or UBI initiatives.

questions.query: Ethical Compliance: Confirm you have read and will comply with the ethical standards outlined in the eligibility criteria.
questions.explanation: Yes

questions.query: Additional Info: Is there anything else critical for evaluating your project that wasn't covered in the questions above?
questions.explanation: Viva la Regenaissance!
